# isShown

**Instance Property**

The display state of the popover.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var isShown: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

The value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the popover is being shown, [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] otherwise.

The popover is considered to be shown from the point when [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPopover/show(relativeTo:of:preferredEdge:)] is invoked. A popover is considered closed in response to an invocation of either [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPopover/close()] or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPopover/performClose(_:)].

## Managing a Popover’s Appearance

- **appearance**: The appearance of the popover.
- **effectiveAppearance**: The appearance that will be used when the popover is displayed onscreen.
- **animates**: Specifies if the popover is to be animated.
- **contentSize**: The content size of the popover.
- **isDetached**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the window created by a popover’s detachment is automatically created.
